00022 /**
00023  * @file   QuantDabg.h
00024  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00025  * @date   Thu Dec 29 16:15:28 2005
00026  * 
00027  * @brief Class for doing Detected Above BackGround (DABG) analysis. Idea is to
00028  * use the intensity of probes in a probeset to calculate a p-value for the
00029  * entire probeset. The individual intensities are compared to a set of
00030  * background probes.
00031  */
00032 #ifndef _QUANTDABG_H_
00033 #define _QUANTDABG_H_
00034 
00035 //
00036 #include "chipstream/ChipStream.h"
00037 #include "chipstream/IntensityMart.h"
00038 #include "chipstream/PmAdjuster.h"
00039 #include "chipstream/ProbeSet.h"
00040 #include "chipstream/QuantExprMethod.h"
00041 //
00042 #include "dabg/Dabg.h"
00043 #include "util/Err.h"

00045 #include <cstring>

00050 /// our standardized name
00051 #define QUANTDABGSTR "dabg"
00052 
00053 /**
00054  * @brief Class for doing Detected Above BackGround (DABG) analysis. Idea is to
00055  * use the intensity of probes in a probeset to calculate a p-value for the
00056  * entire probeset. The individual intensities are compared to a set of
00057  * background probes.
00058  */
00059 class QuantDabg : public QuantExprMethod {
00060 
00061 public:
00062 
00063   /** 
00064    * What version of the algorithm are we implementing?
00065    * @return version string.
00066    */
00067   std::string getVersion() {
00068     return "2.0";
00069   }
00070 
00071   /**
00072    * Constructor.
00073    */
00074   QuantDabg(bool doFisher, bool doPercentile, double percentile, bool reportLog, int adjustment) :
00075     m_DoFisher(doFisher), m_DoPercentile(doPercentile), 
00076     m_PercentileEst(percentile), m_ReportLog(reportLog), m_Adjustment(adjustment) { 
00077     if(m_DoPercentile && m_DoFisher) {
00078       Err::errAbort("QuantDabg::QuantDabg() - Can't do chisq and percentile at same time.");
00079     }
00080     setupSelfDoc(*this);
00081     m_Type = getDocName();
00082     m_DabgInit = false;
00083         setOptValue("chisq", doFisher);
00084     setOptValue("percentile", ToStr(m_PercentileEst));
00085         setOptValue("usepercentile", doPercentile);
00086     setOptValue("neglog10", reportLog);
00087   }
00088 
00089   /** 
00090    * @brief Does this quantification method estimate feature effects?
00091    * @return false as we don't have feature effects.
00092    */
00093   inline bool haveFeatureEffects() { return false;}
00094 
00095   /** 
00096    * @brief Does this quantification method supply residuals?
00097    * @return false as dabg doesn't have a residual
00098    */
00099   inline bool haveResiduals() { return true;}
00100 
00101   inline double getResidual(unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx) { 
00102     return m_ProbePvals[chipIx][probeIx];
00103   }
00104 
00105   /** 
00106    * @brief Get the feature effect of a particular probe.
00107    * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe sets.
00108    * @return feature (probe) effects.
00109    */
00110   inline double getFeatureEffect(unsigned int probeIx) {
00111     Err::errAbort("Don't do feature effects.");
00112     return -1;
00113   } 
00114 
00115   /** 
00116    * Which probes should be used as the background distribution.
00117    * @param bgProbes - vector of probes to be used, memory 
00118    * owned elsewhere.
00119    */
00120   void setBgProbes(const std::vector<Probe *> &bgProbes);
00121 
00122   /** 
00123    * Which probes should be used as the background distribution.
00124    * @param bgProbes - vector of probe ids to be used, memory 
00125    * owned elsewhere.
00126    */
00127   void setBgProbes(const std::vector<int> &bgProbes);
00128 
00129   /** 
00130    * How many probes are in the background list?
00131    * @return - number of probes being used for background.
00132    */
00133   uint32_t getBgProbeCount() {
00134     return (uint32_t) m_BgProbes.size();
00135   }
00136 
00137   void setParameters(PsBoard &board) {
00138     DataStore *info = board.getProbeInfo();
00139     std::vector<int> bgProbes;
00140     info->getGcControlProbes(bgProbes);
00141     setBgProbes(bgProbes);
00142     info->getProbeGc(m_ProbeGcVec);
00143   }
00144 
00145   /** 
00146    * @brief Get the p-value that a probeset came from the background
00147    * distribution for a particular chip.
00148    *
00149    * @param chipIx - Index of chip in experiment.
00150    * @return p-value for probeset in particular chip.
00151    */
00152   inline double getSignalEstimate(unsigned int chipIx) {
00153     assert(chipIx < m_ChipCount);
00154     return m_SetPvals[chipIx];
00155   }
00156 
00157   /** 
00158    * @brief Alias for getSignalEstimate().
00159    * @param chipIx - Index of chip in experiment.
00160    * @return p-value for probeset in particular chip.
00161    */
00162   inline double getTargetEffect(unsigned int chipIx) { 
00163     return getSignalEstimate(chipIx);
00164   }
00165 
00166   /** 
00167    * Nothing to clear yet. 
00168    */
00169   void clear() {}
00170 
00171   /** 
00172    * @brief Set the PM data at probe set probe index and chip index.
00173    * 
00174    * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe set.
00175    * @param chipIx - Index of chip.
00176    * @param data - Data to be set.
00177    */
00178   inline void setPMDataAt(unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx, double data) {
00179     assert(chipIx < m_ChipCount && probeIx < m_ProbeCount);
00180     m_PM[chipIx][probeIx] = data;
00181   }
00182 
00183 /** 
00184    * @brief Get the PM data at probe set probe index and chip index.
00185    * 
00186    * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe set.
00187    * @param chipIx - Index of chip.
00188    */
00189   inline double getPMDataAt(unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx) {
00190     assert(chipIx < m_ChipCount && probeIx < m_ProbeCount);
00191         return (double) m_PM[chipIx][probeIx];
00192   }
00193 
00194   /** 
00195    * @brief Set the MM data at probe set probe index and chip
00196    * index. Currently a no-operation as dabg doesn't use mm probes.
00197    * 
00198    * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe set.
00199    * @param chipIx - Index of chip.
00200    * @param data - Data to be set.
00201    */
00202   inline void setMMDataAt(unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx, double data) {}
00203 
00204   /** 
00205    * Set the number of probes and number of chips to be used for estimation.
00206    * @param numProbes - Probe count.
00207    * @param numChips - Microarray count.
00208    */
00209   void setBounds(unsigned int numProbes, unsigned int numChips);
00210 
00211   /** 
00212    * What scale are the target effects on? Are they linear (like
00213    * plier) or log2 (like rma)
00214    * @return - What scale are the results provided in?
00215    */
00216   virtual Scale getScale() { return m_ReportLog ? NegLog10 : Pvalue; }
00217 
00218   /** 
00219    * What type of quantification method is this? Summarization like
00220    * plier detection like dabg.
00221    * @return - Type of quantification method.
00222    */
00223   virtual enum QuantType getQuantType() { return Detection; }
00224 
00225   /** 
00226    * @brief Do the heavy lifting of median polish. If PM-MM is zero
00227    * threshold at a small positive number to avoid taking logs of
00228    * numbers that aren't positive.
00229    */
00230   void computeEstimate();
00231 
00232   /** 
00233    * @brief Set up the quantification method given all the data about the probe
00234    * set, chip  and data.
00235    * 
00236    * @param psGroup - Probes to be used for final estimate.
00237    * @param iMart - Raw data from chips.
00238    * @param iTrans - Transformations to be applied to data before use.
00239    * @param pmAdjust - How to estimate background, or MM probe.
00240    * @return True if setup sucessful, false otherwise.
00241    */
00242   bool setUp(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, const IntensityMart &iMart, 
00243              std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans, PmAdjuster &pmAdjust);
00244 
00245   /** 
00246    * @brief Return number of features (probes).
00247    * @return feature count.
00248    */
00249   inline unsigned int getNumFeatures()  { return m_ProbeCount; }
00250 
00251   /** 
00252    * @brief Return number of targets (experiments or chips).
00253    * @return target count
00254    */
00255   inline unsigned int getNumTargets() { return m_ChipCount; }

00257   /** 
00258    * @brief Default Getter method for parameters and their documentation.
00259    * @return map of parameters and their descriptions.
00260    */
00261   static std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> getDefaultDocOptions() { 
00262     std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> opts;
00263         SelfDoc::Opt chisq = {"chisq", SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean, "true", "true", "NA", "NA",
00264                           "Use Fisher's chi-squared method for combining individual probe p-values."};
00265     opts.push_back(chisq);
00266     SelfDoc::Opt usepercentile = {"usepercentile", SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean, "false", "false", "NA", "NA",
00267                           "Use a individual probe p-value at a particular percentile as the estimator."};
00268     opts.push_back(usepercentile);
00269     SelfDoc::Opt percentile = {"percentile", SelfDoc::Opt::Double, ".25", ".25", "0", "1",
00270                                "Percentile to use for the probe p-value as an estimator for the entire probeset."};
00271     opts.push_back(percentile);
00272     SelfDoc::Opt neglog10 = {"neglog10", SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean, "false", "false", "NA", "NA",
00273                              "Report -1 * log_10(p-value) rather than raw p-value."};
00274     opts.push_back(neglog10);
00275         SelfDoc::Opt adjust = {"adjust-dof", SelfDoc::Opt::Integer, "0", "0", "NA", "NA",
00276                        "Adjustment of the degrees of freedom for the chi-squared test."};
00277     opts.push_back(adjust);
00278         SelfDoc::Opt probeMd5 = {"subsetmd5", SelfDoc::Opt::String, "", "", "NA", "NA",
00279                              "Md5sum of the probe ids being used as background."};
00280     opts.push_back(probeMd5);
00281     return opts;
00282   }
00283 
00284   /** 
00285    * Fill in the information for Self documentation.
00286    * @param doc - Self documenter to be filled in.
00287    */
00288   static void setupSelfDoc(SelfDoc &doc) {
00289     doc.setDocName(QUANTDABGSTR);
00290     doc.setDocDescription("Calculates the p-value that the intensities in a probeset could have been observed by chance in a background distribution. Used as a substitute for standard absent/present calls when mismatch probes are not available.");
00291     doc.setDocOptions(getDefaultDocOptions());
00292   }
00293 
00294   /** 
00295    * @brief Supply a little how/what/why about the algorithms this
00296    * class performs and what parameters it takes.
00297    * @return SelfDoc
00298    */
00299   static SelfDoc explainSelf() { 
00300     SelfDoc doc;
00301     setupSelfDoc(doc);
00302     return doc;
00303   }

00305   /** 
00306    * @brief This static function should be overridden by child classes
00307    * to return an object of the correct type initialized correctly
00308    * with the parameters in the string, string map. All objects
00309    * created this way should be deleted when finished using.
00310    * 
00311    * @param param - Map of key/value pairs to initialize the object.
00312    * 
00313    * @return Pointer toCreate object, this should be sub casted as necessary.
00314    */
00315   static SelfCreate *newObject(std::map<std::string,std::string> &param);

00317   /**
00318    * @brief What should the residual file be called?
00319    */
00320   virtual const std::string &getResidualSuffix() {
00321     static std::string suffix = ".probe-pvalues.txt";
00322     return suffix;
00323   }

00325   /**
00326    * Specify the gc count for probes as indexed by position
00327    */
00328   void setGcProbes(const std::vector<char> &gcVec) {
00329     m_ProbeGcVec = gcVec;
00330   }

00332   /**
00333    * set the bgpFile name
00334    * @param bgpFile
00335    */
00336   void setBgpFileName(std::string bgpFile) {
00337     m_BgpFile = bgpFile;
00338   }

00340 private:
00341   /** 
00342    * Setup the dabg objects with intensity data from background probes. This should
00343    * be called only once.
00344    * 
00345    * @param iMart - Contains data for background probes for each chip.
00346    * @param iTrans - Chipstream transformations for raw data in iMart.
00347    * @param pmAdjust - Adjuster for perfect match probes.
00348    */
00349   void initializeDabg(const IntensityMart &iMart, 
00350                       std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans, 
00351                       PmAdjuster &pmAdjust);
00352 
00353   /** 
00354    * Return the -1 * log_10(val). Val is capped at FLT_MIN to avoid taking lots of values <= 0. 
00355    * @param val - Regular p-value.
00356    * @return -1 * log_10(val)
00357    */
00358   double negLog10Prob(double val);
00359 
00360   /// Number of chips in experiment
00361   unsigned int m_ChipCount;
00362   /// Number of probes (features) in probe sets
00363   unsigned int m_ProbeCount;
00364   /// Data matrix for PM probes.
00365   std::vector<std::vector<double> > m_PM;
00366   /// G/C count for each probe in probeset being called
00367   std::vector<int> m_GcProbeCounts;
00368   /// P-values for probeset in different chips.
00369   std::vector<double> m_SetPvals;
00370   /// P-values for individual probes in different chips.
00371   std::vector<std::vector<double> > m_ProbePvals;
00372   /// Vector of probes to use as background distribution. Memory owned elsewhere
00373   std::vector<int> m_BgProbes;
00374   /// Have we initialized the dabg object with data yet?
00375   bool m_DabgInit;
00376   /// Objects implementing algorithm, one per chip.
00377   std::vector<affx::Dabg> m_Dabgs;
00378   /// Use Fisher's chi-squared method for combining individual probe p-values.
00379   bool m_DoFisher;
00380   /// Use a partcular percentile of probe p-values as an estimator.
00381   bool m_DoPercentile;
00382   /// Percentile of probe p-value to use as estimator.
00383   double m_PercentileEst;
00384   /// Should we report -1 * log_10(p-value) rather than raw p-value.
00385   double m_ReportLog;
00386   /// Adjust the degrees of freedom by one.
00387   int m_Adjustment;
00388   /// Md5sum of probe ids used for background
00389   std::string m_ProbeMd5Sum;
00390   /// GC count of each probe as indexed by position.
00391   std::vector<char> m_ProbeGcVec;
00392   /// Name of bgpFile
00393   std::string m_BgpFile;
00394 };
